<math alttext="N O 2 C l, gas, plus C l, gas, react to produce N O 2, gas, plus C l 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>Cl</mi><mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Cl</mi><msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>â†’</mo><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>Cl</mi></mpadded></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded></math>
The single-step reaction represented above takes place in a sealed container. Which of the following will reduce the value of <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>, the rate constant for the reaction?

choices.label: Decreasing the size of the sealed container
Increasing the size of the sealed container

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
